posts.name: Shawn Bailey
posts.cooked: hello, I am writing about a coding issue. Every time we push code with this line it breaks it. m_intake = new CANSparkMax(m_intake7ID, MotorType.kBrushed); I didn’t find anywhere that said k.Brushed was replaced but I don’t know if I am missing something?
Can you provide the stack trace?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.custom_user_title: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Shawn Bailey

posts.cooked: I do not see anything necessarily wrong here. Can you clarify if the problem happens at build time when you deploy or is a crash while the program runs?

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.custom_user_title: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Shawn Bailey
posts.cooked: we got it to deploy to the robot but ow we have a problem that no matter how we do the CAN Bus we can’t get at least 1 Spark Max to be identified

posts.name: Shawn Bailey
posts.cooked:
note this comes up for our brushed motor and it killed all robot code

[ CAN SPARK] IDs: 7, Error Invalid Cannot set motor type to kBrushed for SPARK without a dock connected.

Interesting, it seems to think that it is a SparkFLEX. I assume that this is something in CANSparkBase that should not be.

@Greg_Needel

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.custom_user_title: Doubling the current limit does not make it work.

posts.name: Shawn Bailey
posts.cooked: We finally got it working and it worked just after pushing code about 5 more times.
